p: Biochanin A (5,7-dihydroxy-3-(4-methoxyphenyl)chromen-4-one) ( Figure 6) is an O-methylated isoflavone found mainly in soybeans and red clover and has several effects, including anti-inflammatory, anti-cancer and neuroprotective [ 128]. It showed gastroprotective activity (25 and 50 mg/kg, p.o., rat) in the ethanol model, which was attributed to increased NO level and SOD activity and decreased MDA, with omeprazole (20 mg/kg) as a reference group [ 129].
